titleStmt.title: The eye cleard; or a preservative for the sight. Being a quaint composition without fenell or eye-bright, to restore the poreblind, and make the squint-eye to looke forthright. VVith the gratefull acknowledgement of much comfort already received in that kinde by divers, through this, and other remedies applyed by the author.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed according to order for G. Bishop,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
